net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver
Class GatheringWritableSelectorHandler

java.lang.Object
  net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.GatheringWritableSelectorHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
iResponseWriter, iSelectorHandler, iWritableSelectorHandler, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlainWritableSelectorHandler
public class GatheringWritableSelectorHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements iWritableSelectorHandler, java.lang.Runnable

Note: do NOT use this class with JDK 1.4.2, instead use the subclass which contains a workaround for the gathering-write bugs in 1.4.2 (PlainWritableSelectorHandler)

This class starts it's thread using the GlobalErrorLoggingThreadGroup, so it is safe to be used as a PRIMARY thread (c.f. GlobalErrorLoggingThreadGroup)

See Also:
GlobalErrorLoggingThreadGroup, PlainWritableSelectorHandler

createSelector

public java.nio.channels.Selector createSelector()

Description copied from interface: iSelectorHandler
In most situations, any IOException during this method means a System.exit() is necessary - but it's far too dangerous to do that by default, so implementations are expected to re-throw any IOException's even if they catch them, unless they can take appropriate behaviour to fix the problem
